etymologies: early 17th century: via Italian and French oque from Turkish okka, from Arabic ūqīya, based on Latin uncia ‘ounce’

definitions: an Egyptian and former Turkish unit of weight, variable but now usually equal to approximately 1.3 kg (23/4 lb).
shortDefinitions: Egyptian and former Turkish unit of weight, variable but now

definitions: an Egyptian and former Turkish unit of capacity equal to approximately 0.2 liter (1/3 pint).
shortDefinitions: Egyptian and former Turkish unit of capacity equal to approximately 0.2 litre
